df-sitg
blocks.content: Define the integral of simple functions from a measurable space ` dom m ` to a generic space ` w ` equipped with the right scalar product. ` w ` will later be required to be a Banach space. These simple functions are required to take finitely many different values: this is expressed by ` ran g e. Fin ` in the definition. Moreover, for each ` x ` , the pre-image ` ( ``' g " { x } ) ` is requested to be measurable, of finite measure. In this definition, ` ( sigaGen `` ( TopOpen `` w ) ) ` is the Borel sigma-algebra on ` w ` , and the functions ` g ` range over the measurable functions over that Borel algebra. Definition 2.4.1 of [Bogachev] p. 118. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 21-Oct-2017.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-sitg(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(csitg, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, cuni(crn(cmeas)), cmpt(s2, crab(s3, co(cdm(cv(s1)), cmbfm, cfv(csigagen, cfv(ctopn, cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(crn(cv(s3)), cfn), wral(s4, cdif(crn(cv(s3)), csn(cfv(c0g, cv(s0)))), wcel(cfv(cv(s1), cima(ccnv(cv(s3)), csn(cv(s4)))), co(nat0, cico, cpnf))))), co(cv(s0), cgsu, cmpt(s4, cdif(crn(cv(s2)), csn(cfv(c0g, cv(s0)))), co(cfv(cfv(crrh, cfv(csca, cv(s0))), cfv(cv(s1), cima(ccnv(cv(s2)), csn(cv(s4))))), cfv(cvsca, cv(s0)), cv(s4)))))))
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
}

  ‚ä¢ sitg =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà ‚ãÉ ran(measures)‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà { s3 ‚àà(dom(s1)[MblFnM](sigaGen `(TopOpen ` s0)))|(ran(s3)‚àà Fin ‚àß ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà(ran(s3)\ {(0 ` s0)}),(s1 `(`' s3 " { s4 }))‚àà(0[[,)]+‚àû)))} ‚Ü¶(s0[gsum](s4 ‚àà(ran(s2)\ {(0 ` s0)})‚Ü¶(((RRHom `(Scalar ` s0))`(s1 `(`' s2 " { s4 })))[(√ó ` s0)]s4)))))

blocks.name: df-sitm
blocks.content: Define the integral metric for simple functions, as the integral of the distances between the function values. Since distances take nonnegative values in ` RR* ` , the range structure for this integral is ` ( RR*s |``s ( 0 [,] +oo ) ) ` . See definition 2.3.1 of [Bogachev] p. 116. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 22-Oct-2017.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-sitm(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(csitm, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, cuni(crn(cmeas)), cmpo(s2, s3, cdm(co(cv(s0), csitg, cv(s1))), cdm(co(cv(s0), csitg, cv(s1))), cfv(co(co(cxrs, cress, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)), csitg, cv(s1)), co(cv(s2), cof(cfv(cds, cv(s0))), cv(s3))))))
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-sitm(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ sitm =(s0 ‚àà ùïå, s1 ‚àà ‚ãÉ ran(measures)‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà dom((s0[sitg]s1)), s3 ‚àà dom((s0[sitg]s1))‚Ü¶(((‚Ñù*[|`s](0[[,]]+‚àû))[sitg]s1)`(s2[oF((dist ` s0))]s3))))
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: sibfof
blocks.content: Applying function operations on simple functions results in simple functions with regard to the destination space, provided the operation fulfills a simple condition. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 12-Mar-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm sibfof(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, class c9, class c10, class c11, class c12, class c13, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(co(c0, cof(c1), c2), cdm(co(c3, csitg, c4))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cbs, c6))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(ctopn, c6))
  -| wceq(c8, cfv(csigagen, c7))
  -| wceq(c9, cfv(c0g, c6))
  -| wceq(c10, cfv(cvsca, c6))
  -| wceq(c11, cfv(crrh, cfv(csca, c6)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c12))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cuni(crn(cmeas))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(co(c6, csitg, c4))))
  -| wceq(c13, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, ctps))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c1, cxp(c5, c5), c13))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cdm(co(c6, csitg, c4))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, ctps))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, ct1))
  -| wi(w0, wceq(co(c9, c1, c9), cfv(c0g, c3)))
} = {
  mpbir3and(w0, wcel(co(c0, cof(c1), c2), cdm(co(c3, csitg, c4))), wcel(co(c0, cof(c1), c2), co(cdm(c4), cmbfm, cfv(csigagen, cfv(ctopn, c3)))), wcel(crn(co(c0, cof(c1), c2)), cfn), wral(hs0, cdif(crn(co(c0, cof(c1), c2)), csn(cfv(c0g, c3))), wcel(cfv(c4, cima(ccnv(co(c0, cof(c1), c2)), csn(cv(hs0)))), co(nat0, cico, cpnf))))

blocks.name: sitgclg
blocks.content: Closure of the Bochner integral on simple functions, generic version. See ~ sitgclbn for the version for Banach spaces. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 24-Feb-2018.) (Proof shortened by AV, 12-Dec-2019.)

blocks.name: sitgclbn
blocks.content: Closure of the Bochner integral on a simple function. This version is specific to Banach spaces, with additional conditions on its scalar field. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 24-Feb-2018.)

blocks.name: sitmfval
blocks.content: Value of the integral distance between two simple functions. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 30-Jan-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm sitmfval(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, co(c1, csitm, c2), c3), cfv(co(co(cxrs, cress, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)), csitg, c2), co(c0, cof(c4), c3))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cds, c1))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, c5))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cuni(crn(cmeas))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cdm(co(c1, csitg, c2))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cdm(co(c1, csitg, c2))))
} = {
  ovmpt2d(hs0, hs1, c0, co(c1, csitm, c2), c3, cfv(co(co(cxrs, cress, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)), csitg, c2), co(c0, cof(c4), c3)), cdm(co(c1, csitg, c2)), cdm(co(c1, csitg, c2)), cfv(co(co(cxrs, cress, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)), csitg, c2), co(cv(hs0), cof(c4), cv(hs1))), universe, w0)
  sitmval(hs0, hs1, c1, c2, c4, c5, w0)
  fveq2d(co(co(cxrs, cress, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)), csitg, c2), co(cv(hs0), cof(c4), cv(hs1)), co(c0, cof(c4), c3), wa(w0, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c3))))
  oveq12d(cv(hs0), cof(c4), cv(hs1), c0, c3, wa(w0, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c3))))
  simprl(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c3))
  simprr(w0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c3))
  fvexd(co(co(cxrs, cress, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)), csitg, c2), co(c0, cof(c4), c3), w0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)

blocks.name: df-itgm
blocks.content: Define the Bochner integral as the extension by continuity of the Bochnel integral for simple functions. Bogachev first defines 'fundamental in the mean' sequences, in definition 2.3.1 of [Bogachev] p. 116, and notes that those are actually Cauchy sequences for the pseudometric ` ( w sitm m ) ` . He then defines the Bochner integral in chapter 2.4.4 in [Bogachev] p. 118. The definition of the Lebesgue integral, ~ df-itg . (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 13-Feb-2018.)
